TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit WebApplicationUtilities extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A collection of utility functions to help HealthVault web application developers authenticate and perform other actions with HealthVault.
Docs.remarks:
If possible, it is recommended that HealthVault applications derive from . If the requirements for the application don't allow for derivation due to deriving from another base class or needing access from control classes, the static utility methods in this class give the developer access to the same functionality that is available in the .
Methods like and should be called from the application's page and methods respectively.
Other methods help the application with management of the HealthVault cookie. For instance, reads the HealthVault cookie from the request and instantiates the instance for the logged in person. Note, some methods like require another method be called first to handle the user's authentication token. Methods like and deal with storing the HealthVault user information in a cookie or session.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Health.AnonymousConnection AnonymousConnection { get; }
.property class Microsoft.Health.AnonymousConnection AnonymousConnection

Docs.summary: Gets a HealthVault connection for the configured default HealthVault web-service instance without an authentication token for either the user or the application.
Docs.value: A connection to HealthVault that does not contain user or application authentication information.
Docs.exception: If the application private key could not be found in the certificate store to sign requests.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo GetPersonInfo (string authToken);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo GetPersonInfo(string authToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The authentication token for a user. This can be retrieved by extracting the WCToken query string parameter from the request after the user has been redirected to the HealthVault AUTH page. See for more information.
Docs.summary: Gets the authenticated person's information using the specified authentication token from the configured default HealthVault web-service instance.
Docs.returns: The information about the logged in person.
Docs.remarks: Applications that work with more than one HealthVault instance should not call this method. Instead, call the overload which takes an , specifying the HealthVault instance where the session auth token was created.

The HealthVault web-service instance where the session auth token was received from.
Docs.summary: Gets the authenticated person's information using the specified authentication token from the specified HealthVault web-service instance.
Docs.returns: The information about the logged in person.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PageOnInit (System.Web.HttpContext context, bool isPageSslSecure);
.method public static hidebysig void PageOnInit(class System.Web.HttpContext context, bool isPageSslSecure) cil managed

Docs.param: The current request context.
If true, the application requires all connections to this page be over a secure SSL channel.
Docs.summary: Replicates the behavior by redirecting to a secure version of the page if the URL requested is insecure and the application requires a secure connection.
Docs.remarks:
Applications can require certain pages (or all pages) to be accessed only over a secure SSL channel. To do this the application must set the "WCPage_SSLForSecure" config value in the web.config file and pass "true" to .
If the conditions above are true the user's browser will automatically be redirected to a secure version of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo PageOnPreLoad (System.Web.HttpContext context, bool logOnRequired);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo PageOnPreLoad(class System.Web.HttpContext context, bool logOnRequired) cil managed

Docs.param: The current request context.

True if the requested page requires the user to be logged on to HealthVault, or false otherwise. If true and the user isn't logged on, the user's browser will be automatically redirected to the HealthVault authentication page.
Docs.summary: Ensures that the person is logged on if is true.
Docs.remarks: It is recommended that HealthVault applications that cannot derive from call this method during their pages OnPreLoad. This method will ensure that the HealthVault token is extracted from the URL query string, the authenticated person's is retrieved and stored in a cookie. This will make the person's information available through the cookie on all future requests until they log off.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void RedirectToLogOn (System.Web.HttpContext context);
.method public static hidebysig void RedirectToLogOn(class System.Web.HttpContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The current request context.
Docs.summary: Redirects the caller's browser to the logon page for authentication.
Docs.remarks:
After the user successfully authenticates, they get redirected back to the action url for which the target is set to either AppAuthSuccess or AppAuthRejected depending on whether the user authorized one or more records for use with the application, with the authentication token in the query string. This is stripped out and used to populate HealthVault data for the page.
This overload assumes that the applications does not simultaneously deal with multiple records for the same person i.e. isMra is false.

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo RefreshAndSavePersonInfoToCookie(class System.Web.HttpContext context, class Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo personInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: The current request context.
The information about the authenticated person that needs refreshing.
Docs.summary: Cleans the application's session of HealthVault information and then repopulates it.
Docs.remarks: This method should be called anytime an action occurs that will affect the object for the authenticated person. This includes changing the person's authorization for the application or changing the selected record.
Docs.exception: If a person isn't logged on when this is called.

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.PersonInfo RefreshAndSavePersonInfoToCookie(class System.Web.HttpContext context, string authToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The current request context.
The authentication to use to populate the session with HealthVault information.
Docs.summary: Cleans the application's session of HealthVault information and then repopulates it using the specified authentication.
Docs.remarks: This method should be called anytime the application takes a redirect from the HealthVault shell and there is a WCToken on the query string. Note, if you are calling or this is handled for you.
Docs.exception: If HealthVault returns an error when getting information about the person in the .

The HealthVault web-service instance that the session auth token was originally received from.

Docs.remarks: This method should be called anytime the application takes a redirect from the HealthVault shell and there is a WCToken on the query string. Note, if you are calling or this is handled for you.
Docs.exception: If HealthVault returns an error when getting information about the person in the .

The query string parameters to pass to the signout action URL after cleaning up data.
The unique identifier of the application.
The user's credential token to sign out.
The HealthVault instance where the user account resides. If null, the configured default HealthVault Shell URL will be used.

The query string parameters to pass to the signout action URL after cleaning up data.
The unique identifier of the application.
The user's credential token to sign out.
The base HealthVault Shell redirector URL. If null, the configured default HealthVault Shell URL will be used.
